intro: Keumkangsania asiatica, commonly known as the Asian keumkangsania, is a rare flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming in the spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
